website_summaries.verdict: Choose this if you want one that has more to offer for the price than competitors – though it's not suited for professional play, it has everything budget-conscious shoppers need.
pros: Offers user-friendly features for a low price, including tough wooden build that isn't too heavy and wide blade that's ideal for skill development
Comes in youth and junior sizes and can be used for ice or street hockey
cons: Some players aren't thrilled about wood sticks, but this one is more durable than most

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF SIZE CHART- it’s inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The stick itself seems great however the sizing chart is in accurate there for the stick was way too big for my boy. Now I have to go through the hassle of an exchange... It’s so frustrating you cannot use calls to do an exchange and you have to go to an actual UPS store honestly they should just send me the right size and forget about the other one because I am not sure it is worth my time being we haven’t even been able to use the stick it is so big. BEEARE OF SIZE CHART
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Burns

customer_reviews.title: Great starter
customer_reviews.text: My son doesn't play hockey - yet. The pandemic put a pause on him learning how to play roller hockey. But he LOVES this stick. He uses it as a crutch, to help him get up hills. He uses it as a stick, to hit pucks. He uses it as a pretend weapon. It's super durable and versatile, if you have a good imagination!
customer_reviews.author: Becki

customer_reviews.title: Two models shown on pic
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but the hockey sticks picture has been adjusted to show two different models. The 1010-40 model has the "street" word and a solid fin, and the other "NHL" worded one is a better model with holes in the fin. Both are pictured here though and yeah they definitely sent me two lefty sticks and then finally a righty. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Kayura104

customer_reviews.title: Seven years olds can be abusive...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this, a goal, and some street hockey balls for my son as a birthday present. I'm not a hockey expert and we only play street hockey in the driveway, but my boy abuses this stick and it shows very little wear and tear. Durable enough to last at least two years!
customer_reviews.author: AJ's

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t even the right blade on the stick
customer_reviews.text: It was listed as a righty stick and they definitely sent a lefty. Just absolutely don’t know what try’s re advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy sticks for children (and their dad)! I have a 9 and 6 year old and they haven't broken them. They are sturdy! I played rough with them trying to see how they would hold up. Took some hard slap shots and wristers off cement and they didn't break or bow. More than strong enough for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hollenbeck

customer_reviews.title: Great buy - happy kid!!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew has been beating this hockey stick up for two months and it still looks awesome!! He takes it everywhere with him - sometimes I wonder how it’s in one piece still. It was definitely a bargain too for how well it’s holding up.
customer_reviews.author: SWVZ-6

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner hockey stick
customer_reviews.text: We have had this stick for about 5 months now and it’s not broken!! That says a lot since we have a rough bit! This is for a 5’ tall kid. It is a big long for him when he’s playing but he is able to maneuver it and play well despite it being too long. It’s sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: hmincer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely used.
customer_reviews.text: It came fast, but the hockey stick looks like it was already well loved. So there's that. My son saw it and was too excited for me to deal with the mess of sending it back, which is always a nightmare. So... $20 for a used hockey stick.... cool.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri

customer_reviews.title: my 10 year old has been putting it to the test and so far it has held up nicely I can see it lasting for a while
customer_reviews.text: Made fairly well, my 10 year old has been putting it to the test and so far it has held up nicely I can see it lasting for a while. Will update in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mike

customer_reviews.title: This hockey stick is great for a child who is beginning to learn how to play hockey.
customer_reviews.text: My son was extremely happy with this hockey stick. It is just the right size for him and is very sturdy. The only problem I had was that I ordered 2 and they arrived in separate boxes. The boxes are pretty big. No issues with the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Salgado

customer_reviews.title: My son is 5’6, stick is great size for him!
customer_reviews.text: Love love, it’s actually quite heavy & sturdy for price! My son has used hockey tape on it to make last longer. Purchased two Incase I wanna play!!!
customer_reviews.author: CapsMama

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect Sizing and Not Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: We are a hockey family and love to play street hockey. Franklin is one of our go-to's however this time around the sizing was way off and the sticks are just simply not made the way that they used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Buffy Mallwalker

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic stick!  Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great stick. Have had several now. Love them! Perfect size for 12 year old. Great quality. Very sturdy. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia MTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great Sticks
customer_reviews.text: These are a great hight for kids up to about age 13 or 14, very durable and also comfortable to grip. The stand up to the rigors of the kids playing street hockey every day.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Frankhouser

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my grandson who is learning to play “street hockey”. He was delighted
customer_reviews.author: Janet N

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My 7-year old got it for Christmas and plays "street hockey" in the garage with it. He falls a lot and it hasn't broken yet, although the paint is starting to come off in a few places. He doesn't really use it competitively or anything, but it works for his needs.
customer_reviews.author: A Faithful Viewer

customer_reviews.title: Great sticks
customer_reviews.text: Great sticks for me and the kids to play street hockey.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin hewlett

customer_reviews.title: Not great longevity
customer_reviews.text: I loved this stick while it lasted but broke on the top part of the heel after just over 2 months of use. To me it looks like the laminate was installed improperly and should have gone around the stick. Now I’m outside of my warranty
customer_reviews.author: BAS

customer_reviews.title: Righty versus lefty
customer_reviews.text: The description of this item says "right handed" however when we opened the box we found it was made for a left handed player. This item was a gift and now I am out of my return window.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old hasn't torn it up yet so it must be tough.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This stick is pretty flimsy. It is good for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: This stick is pretty flimsy. It is good for younger kids, who may not play as hard as those ages 8 and up.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Got a right handed and a left handed stick. Perfect for driveway and street play.
customer_reviews.author: CNW

customer_reviews.title: great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! We needed a couple extra sticks for pick-up hockey and these work perfectly! Boys are 7 and 9 and they fit just right!
customer_reviews.author: Keri Doolittle

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Stick is solid and durable. Stick head is a bit loose after tightening twice. Doesn’t affect the use of the stick too much at amateur/non-competitive level
customer_reviews.author: Maria Giardino

customer_reviews.title: Its a left not a right
customer_reviews.text: It is advertised a right handed stick and my 5 year old was trying to use it and we realized it is a left handed stick. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size issue ........STOP!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought the sticks were for 8 yr olds through 10 but kinda small. More like a 6 yr old average size. Or a smurf.
customer_reviews.author: LukiKai

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but we are not hockey pros, and it only gets occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Grigg

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stick
customer_reviews.text: I ORIGINALLY PURCHASED THE MYLEC MODEL STICK FOR MY 12YR OLD, FIGURED THIS STICK AND SIZE WOULD BE PERFECT FOR MY 10YR OLD.... NICE STICK, DON'T GET ME WRONG, BUT SMALL!!! NOT WHAT I EXPECTED, FOR HIS AGE ANYWAY!!! SO FOR A LITTLE LAUGH MY HUSBAND AND I CALLED OUR 4 ALMOST 5YR OLD DAUGHTER TO SEE HOW THE STICK HOLDS UP TO HER,SHE'S A ROUGH TOUGH BUT YET LITTLE PRINCESS, ROLLERBLADES AND ALL!!! WELL WE WERE SHOCKED!!! FIT HER TO A T!!!!!! SO MY OPINIONS FOR STICKS...GET THIS ONE FOR YOUR LIL ONES.... AND A DEFINITE MUST....THE MYLEC....$9.99Amazon FOR YOUR OLDER KIDS AND ADULTS TOO!!! NICE STICK
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE M

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time, the only problem I can say is that the shaft of the stick seems a bit too thin and flimsy. But for the price you really can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for making my son happy!!
customer_reviews.text: These are so fun and sturdy! My son and his friends absolutely have loved playing with these sticks! Excellent item!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori J Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great present for future oice hockey star
customer_reviews.text: Well made and a Big hit with my 7 year old grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Goldoa

customer_reviews.title: Durable Stick for Son
customer_reviews.text: Son loves playing hockey. And this stick is the right size and it's very durable
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the junior version and it is the perfect size for me (5'4").
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. One had a stripped screw that o had to replace right away
customer_reviews.author: M. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use
customer_reviews.text: Broke during the first. Very disappointed birthday for my 9 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ingenbohs

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids 10-14 I think
customer_reviews.text: Works ok for basic play but is heavy compared to standard sticks. Good for kids 10-14 I think.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dave

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and she absolutely loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great beginner stick for the price and durable. Has lasted through my 8 yr old's punishment/temper.
customer_reviews.author: Zed

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how good the stick is
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how good the stick is, to be honest. Needed a short stick for our four year old in IP hockey and this was the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: It was recommended for this age and yet it towers over him
customer_reviews.text: I am very frustrated. I purchased this as a gift for an 11 year old. It was recommended for this age and yet it towers over him. The stick was advertised as 52 inches but measures 60 inches! He plays in a street hockey league and the coach said this is way too long. Even more frustrating is that today is the 31st day after purchase and I just learned that yesterday was the last day to return. Very, very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Street Hockey Stick
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality stick. The wooden shaft is much sturdier than the plastic versions. The kids are really enjoying them.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES FULLER

customer_reviews.title: Street Hockey Sticks
customer_reviews.text: These hockey sticks were a gift for a aspiring hockey player. My hockey player like all great athletes enjoys to practice, so when he is not on the ice or playing inline hockey games these practice sticks are fun to use outside. He is very excited to use these with his friends outside. I'm happy because playtime outside is important. Play outside and leave the video controllers alone. Fun times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An ok street hockey stick for a kid
customer_reviews.text: It is smaller and thinner than the Mylec stick. But my son likes it so as long as it works for him.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky

customer_reviews.title: not what was advertised in the photo
customer_reviews.text: ordered 3 for my kids. opened the box and two were orange and one was yellow. details and pictures show black shaft with blue lettering.
customer_reviews.author: J L

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good height for my 12 year old, but he also has room to grow. It is holing up to some abuse too, without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

product_meta.title: Franklin Sports NHL SX Comp 1010 Street Tech Hockey Stick
